name: Lost for Words! 26 Quiz | Lyrics Mixture | 10 Questions

questions.text:
What word is missing from this song lyric?

"Wake up Maggie I think I got something to say to you 
It's late _________ and I really should be back at school"
questions.explanation:
September.

	"Maggie May" was a chart topping hit for Rod Stewart in both the US and UK, in 1971. It featured on the album "Every Picture Tells A Story". This song was originally the B-side to "Reason to Believe", but it proved to be more popular. "Maggie May" is said to be about Rod's first serious girlfriend.

questions.text:
"When I'm drivin' in my car 
And that man comes on the radio 
And he's tellin' me more and more 
About some _______ information 
Supposed to fire my imagination"

What did the singer think of the information?
questions.explanation:
useless.

	The Rolling Stones topped the US and UK charts with "(I Can't Get No) Satisfaction" in 1965. It features on the Stones album "Out Of Our Heads".Keith Richards created the famous distorted guitar riff using a Gibson Fuzz Box effects unit.When the Stones sang "Satisfaction" on a 1966 "The Ed Sullivan Show" the line "Trying to make some girl" was bleeped out of the performance.

questions.text:
"Imagine me and you, I do 
I think about you day and night, it's only right 
To think about the girl you love and hold her tight 
So happy ______"

What word completes this Turtles song lyric?
questions.explanation:
together.

	The Turtles were "Happy Together" in 1967. The song was written by Gary Bonner and Alan Gordon. A US #1 "Happy Together" peaked at #12 in the UK. The group, originally called The Nightriders, went through several name changes before becoming The Turtles in 1965.

questions.text:
"Yesterday all my ______ seemed so far away. 
Now it looks as though they're here to stay. 
Oh, I believe in yesterday."

So, what dilemma seemed so far away?
questions.explanation:
troubles.

	Lyrics from "Yesterday", the most often covered Beatles song. Although credited to the Beatles this was a solo effort from Paul McCartney. He had the tune worked out before completing the lyrics and gave it the working title "scrambled eggs". This US chart topping single featured on the group's "Help" album.

questions.text:
What word is missing from this classic from Santana?

"You've got to change your ______ ways, baby, 
before I stop lovin' you. 
You've got to change, baby, 
and every word that I say is true"
questions.explanation:
evil.

	This Santana track featured on the album also called "Santana". "Evil Ways" was written by Sonny Henry. The group is named after its leader Carlos Santana, who has worldwide sales in excess of 80 million albums.

questions.text:
"Laughing and a running hey, hey 
Skipping and a jumping 
In the misty morning fog with 
Our hearts a thumpin' and you 
My ______ eyed girl, 
You my ______ eyed girl"

What colour are the girl's eyes?
questions.explanation:
brown.

	These lyrics come from Van Morrison's 1967 hit "Brown Eyed Girl". Van Morrison also wrote this song which peaked at #10 in the US singles charts. It was originally called "Brown Skinned Girl" and the title was changed for fear of being banned by radio stations. This track features on Van Morrison's "Blowin' Your Mind" album.

questions.text:
"When you turn on your smile 
I feel my heart go wild 
I'm like a child with a brand new toy 
And I get the 
Sweetest ______."

Can you fill the blank in this Jackie Wilson lyric?
questions.explanation:
feeling.

	"I Get The Sweetest Feeling" was a UK hit for Jackie Wilson in 1972. It also re-entered the UK singles chart in 1975 and 1987. Jackie Wilson's other hits include "Higher and Higher" and "Reet Petite". He was inducted into the "Rock and Roll Hall of Fame" in 1987.

questions.text:
"A pair of forty-fives made me open my eyes
My temperature started to rise
She was a long cool woman in a ______ dress
Just-a five-nine, beautiful, tall"

So, what colour was that dress?
questions.explanation:
black.

	"Long Cool Woman (In A Black Dress)" was a hit for British band The Hollies in 1971. This track, which featured on the album "Distant Light", charted at #2 in the US and #32 in the UK. The Hollies were noted for their close vocal harmonies.

questions.text:
"We skipped the light Fandango 
Turned cartwheels 'cross the floor 
I was feeling kind of ______ 
But the crowd called out for more"

Strange lyrics, but what word is missing?
questions.explanation:
seasick.

	Procol Harum released "A Whiter Shade Of Pale" in the 1967 Summer of Love. The strange lyrics were laid over a tune based on a classical composition by J S Bach. The song is credited as having been written by Keith Reid and the group's singer Gary Brooker. "A Whiter Shade Of Pale" topped the UK singles chart, and peaked at #5 in the US.

questions.text:
"Take out the papers and the trash
Or you don't get no spendin' cash
If you don't ______ that kitchen floor
You ain't gonna rock and roll no more
Yakety yak... don't talk back"

What word fills the gap in this vintage lyric?
questions.explanation:
scrub.

	"Yakety Yak" topped the US singles chart for doo-wop group The Coasters in 1958. "Yakety Yak" was written by Jerry Leiber and Mike Stoller. The Coasters were inducted into the "Rock and Roll Hall of Fame" in 1987.
